intro: Zygogynum vieillardii, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its attractive, showy flowers that come in a variety of colors. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, often with a short, thick stem and broad, waxy leaves. Its flowers are usually clustered in inflorescences and are pollinated by insects. Zygogynum vieillardii is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
